review_and_appreciate:
Review and Appreciate: How often and how well were you able to decide and declare that you were safe yesterday?
      Here is where the last 2 steps converge: you must be present in the moment to be able to notice that you are safe,
      for your body to let go and engage recovery. Use sitting down for a meal, or entering your home as cues,
      indicating that you are safe and can let go. Get onto The Path of recovery today.“When the way comes to an end, then change. Having changed, you pass through\" I Ching

step_of_the_day.title:
Step of the Day:
      Flexibility and your ability to adapt and learn from new experiences (Pillar #8)
step_of_the_day.content:
There are many ways being flexible helps you function at your best and enhances your resilience response. You can
      be flexible in your perspective – shifting perspective to approach a situation differently and better problem
      solve. It can refer to bending but not breaking, or to adjust your goals for greater success. Today I suggest that you be flexible about your view of yourself. Many of us hold outdated negative beliefs about
      ourselves. They are based on inappropriate messages of childhood. The result is feeling like we are defective, not
      OK, or don’t deserve. Once these self-assessments harden, they interfere with more recent experiences. In other
      words, we ignore our achievements over many years, as we defer to early imprinted messages.

journal_entry: Notate your successes and achievements and allow yourself to fully appreciate your accomplishments.
